intro: Gynoxys yananoensis, commonly known as the Yanano sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has a compact, bushy habit. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in a single head. Gynoxys yananoensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also studied for its potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
